text: Our challenge initially with the cloud was

that all of our systems were
hosted in the data center,
and our teams were organized

around managing data
center infrastructure.
Migrating to the cloud required us to

level up our internal staff
and migrate workloads.
AMS and AWS support have helped us

every step of the way
on our cloud journey.

AWS Managed Services
handled operational tasks

while our teams focused on
migrating additional workloads.
AMS helped manage our workloads

after they were migrated to
AWS and focused on backups
and allowed our team to work on migrating
additional services out to AWS.
AWS Enterprise Support
and our account team all work together

with our internal teams to
manage our infrastructure.
Within the first year,

we migrated about 80%
of our workload to AWS.
For new workloads,
AWS helps us deploy them

within days or weeks
instead of months and years.
We're still exploring using AMS

for additional services,
including patching.

One of the things I really
liked about working with AMS

is that it allowed my
internal teams to work
with experts in the cloud
and kind of adapt some of that culture.

AWS and WaFd Bank are both
really focused on our customers.
Building on AWS gives us the elasticity

and scale to build new
applications for our customers.
